IRPact_modellierung.messaging

Class UniformMessageScheme

  • java.lang.Object
    • IRPact_modellierung.messaging.MessageScheme
      • IRPact_modellierung.messaging.CompanyAgentMessageScheme
        • IRPact_modellierung.messaging.UniformMessageScheme

  • public class UniformMessageScheme
extends CompanyAgentMessageScheme
    The UniformMessageScheme is the most basic CompanyAgentMessageScheme implemented, since it doesn't take any parameters. For CompanyAgents it will create a set of messages with one CompanyConsumerPerceptionManipulationMessage for each consumerAgent in the simulationContainer and each ProductAttributes of the products managed by the sender, with the true value of the product attribute and an advertisement factor of 1.0. The messages are thus created uniformly, and no parameterization of the scheme is possible.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UniformMessageScheme() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<Message> createMessages(SimulationContainer simulationContainer, Agent sendingAgent)
      For agents of an unspecified type, the UniformMessageScheme will create the messages according to how it does for a CompanyAgent if the sendingAgent is a CompanyAgent and throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the agent is of a different type (for whom this scheme is not yet implemented)
      java.util.Set<Message> createMessages(SimulationContainer simulationContainer, CompanyAgent sender)
      The UniformMessageScheme will uniformly (for each ConsumerAgent and each product managed by the CompanyAgent and each of its ProductAttributes) create a CompanyConsumerPerceptionManipulationMessage from the respective CompanyAgent to the respective ConsumerAgent with the true value of the product attribute and an advertisement factor of 1.0.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • createMessages

        public java.util.Set<Message> createMessages(SimulationContainer simulationContainer,
                                             CompanyAgent sender)
        The UniformMessageScheme will uniformly (for each ConsumerAgent and each product managed by the CompanyAgent and each of its ProductAttributes) create a CompanyConsumerPerceptionManipulationMessage from the respective CompanyAgent to the respective ConsumerAgent with the true value of the product attribute and an advertisement factor of 1.0.
        Specified by:
        createMessages in class CompanyAgentMessageScheme
        Parameters:
        simulationContainer - The container the scheme is associated with
        sender - The CompanyAgent sending the messages
        Returns:
        A set of messages with one CompanyConsumerPerceptionManipulationMessage for each consumerAgent in the simulationContainer and each ProductAttributes of the products managed by the sender, with the true value of the product attribute and an advertisement factor of 1.0

      • createMessages

        public java.util.Set<Message> createMessages(SimulationContainer simulationContainer,
                                             Agent sendingAgent)
                                      throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        For agents of an unspecified type, the UniformMessageScheme will create the messages according to how it does for a CompanyAgent if the sendingAgent is a CompanyAgent and throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the agent is of a different type (for whom this scheme is not yet implemented)
        Specified by:
        createMessages in class MessageScheme
        Parameters:
        simulationContainer - The container the simulation runs in
        sendingAgent - The agent from whom the messages originate
        Returns:
        One message for each consumer agent in the simulationContainer for each product attibute of each product managed by the sendingAgent (if its a CompanyAgent).
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Will be thrown when the sendingAgent is not a CompanyAgent
